item.title: Dump of fly tipping, 16th December
item.description:
Dump of fly-tipping on the corner of the road. there are multiple dog waste bags which are a hazard. please remove

item.title: Wood, 16th December
item.description:
Email received by CSC inbox 16/12/25 09:26 Fly-tipping Lat/Long - 51.4171994, -0.0579317 what3words - hurry.fake.vague Nearest address - 20 High Street, Penge, London, SE20 7HG Flytipped wood by the rear entrance to the primary school, just a few yards downhill from the One Stop shop. Reference - 5188583 Map link - open Google map Report history - Status: Received 16/12/2025 09:24 Flytipped wood by the rear entrance to the primary school, just a few yards downhill from the One Stop shop.

item.title: Waste, 16th December
item.description:
Email received by CSC inbox 16/12/25 09:19 Other litter Lat/Long - 51.4172203, -0.0583555 what3words - luxury.good.small Nearest address - 20 High Street, Penge, London, SE20 7HG Bromley owns the green space in front of The Range, but is failing to maintain it. There's no argument about whose responsibility this is. I am an LBB Street Friend, have extensive email correspondence about this matter and have seen the Land Registry details. There is currently a dumped pallet and traffic cone and extensive littering. This site is always an absolute eyesore. Please take charge of it once and for all! Reference - 5188555 Map link - open Google map Report history - Status: Received 16/12/2025 09:18 Bromley owns the green space in front of The Range, but is failing to maintain it. There's no argument about whose responsibility this is. I am an LBB Street Friend, have extensive email correspondence about this matter and have seen the Land Registry details. There is currently a dumped pallet and traffic cone and extensive littering. This site is always an absolute eyesore. Please take charge of it once and for all!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 16th December
item.description:
There is a very deep pothole on Lulworth Road outside number 23. It is a danger to cars as it throws them off course causing damage to tyres and makes them veer towards the pavement endangering pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lulworth Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned broken bin., 16th December
item.description:
A blue bin for domestic recycling has been moved here from somewhere else presumably because it is broken (the lid has been removed). People are filling this bin to capacity and the contents continually spill out causing an unsightly mess. Please remove this blue bin as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inoperative Belisha Beacon and associated lamp column on The Cut (SE1 8LW)., 16th December
item.description:
Heading southbound on The Cut, the lighting column which incorporates a Belisha Beacon are both inoperative. The location is adjacent to 86 The Cut in front of the ‘Windmill’ pub. With the early dark nights and large numbers of footfall, the Belisha Beacon and illumination of the zebra-crossing from the lamp column are critically important, and it is hoped the faults can be remedied within a few days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Cut, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is fly tipping at both ends of Maude road SE58NY, 16th December
item.description:
There is an increasing amount of fly tipping on Maude road at both ends, see photos. I also want to comment on the plastic bags used by the council to clear leaves. This makes no sense to me - its not environmentally friendly and the bags have been left along the pavements for weeks. Given that leave are biodegradable, why collect in plastic?. Please do feedback or forward to the correct department

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Maude Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
